thread.title: UPDATE: Police identify woman killed in late Thursday wreck on Bull River Bridge

author: Savannah Morning News
title: UPDATE: Police identify woman killed in late Thursday wreck on Bull River Bridge
text:

By Savannah Morning News Savannah-Chatham police department’s Major Accident Investigation Team responded to a wreck on the Bull River Bridge that claimed the life of Susan Allen Bartoletti, 34, on Thursday night.
At 9:21 p.m. Bartoletti was traveling west on U.S. 80 on a 2012 Genuine Buddy 170 Moped, said Eunicia Baker, police spokeswoman.
Shawntina Jones, 31, was driving east on U.S. 80 in a Pontiac Grand AM.
Bartoletti is believed to have swerved into the eastbound lane, causing the moped to collide with the Pontiac near the midsection of the bridge, Baker said.
Bartoletti was fatally injured on impact. She died at the scene. Jones and her passenger Kenneth Rivera, 27, were transported by ambulance to Memorial University Medical Center for treatment of non-life-threatening injuries.
Southside Fire, EMS, Metro’s Aviation Unit and Islands Precinct patrol officers responded to the scene.
All lanes of the Bull River Bridge were closed to vehicular traffic for approximately four hours.
MAIT continues to investigate.
